faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders vastgoed kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes. Foreign nationals retain equivalent property acquisition rights to Spanish citizens, with simplified purchasing processes through Spanish legal frameworks. Non-residents require Spanish tax identification numbers (NIE) and establish property accounts through Spanish banking systems. Most property transactions complete within 60-90 days following agreement signatures.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van het kopen van vastgoed in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Additional acquisition costs typically represent 8-12% of property valuation, including transfer tax (6-8%), legal fees (1-2%), and notary expenses (0.5-1%). First-time buyers within residency programmes access tax reduction incentives. Annual property ownership involves minimal costs—IBI property tax (0.4-0.6% valuations) and community fees (approximately €100-200 monthly for villa communities).

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes. Major Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgage financing to qualified foreign purchasers, typically funding 60-70% property valuations at competitive rates. Non-residents require NIE tax identification and Spanish bank accounts. UK nationals access specialist bridging finance pending property sales. Mortgage approval processes require employment verification and income documentation.
